reviews.review_msg: You can tell she has a genuine personal interest in the course content. The lectures were engaging and she provides some pretty good outlines to help with note-taking. The midterm and final were difficult but fair.  Required readings from the text were sometimes tedious.
Great teacher, well organized, intesresting course, and i H8 history.(its a history of reactions to crime)I am currently taking another course with her.
Boring, disorganized lectures. Can't believe a prof can be rambling during the whole lecture without any interaction... Completely taught myself during the whole semester...

Alright listen. The reason why I give this guy a high score was because this class was INSANELY easy due to his disorganization so I'm not complaining. Additionally, the TA for this semester is probably the best TA I've ever had at SFU.

Very easy class. Not very structured, where we were only marked by reading responses throughout the semester. Dr. Kinney gave us very flexible dates at the end of the semester, and often pushed back due dates. Overall seems like he wants all his students to do well, although he didn't necessarily lecture us throughout the semester. Overall: great.

listen to me if you want to get easy marks this is the go to guy. All you do is go to the tutorial get the attendance marks and just read every chapter and know the most basic ideas. In exams you just have to summarize the chapters showing some understanding then its a easy B but, if you need an A then read the chapters couple of times.

I personally self-taught myself throughout the whole course. We basically had to memorize the textbook, and rewrite the chapters in the exams. He goes off topic, lectures are pointless, and jokes around in class. I will never take another class with him again. Does not teach anything..
Boring as hell, but you have to love him!
